content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：威廉，你好。我是艾梅伯。你之前说如果我想要了解更多关于招聘中介的信息的话可以联系你。
content.en_text: AMBER: Hello William. This is Amber - you said to phone if I wanted to get more information about the job agency you mentioned.

content.cn_text: 你现在方便吗？
content.en_text: Is now a good time?

content.cn_text: 威廉：啊，你好，艾梅伯。是的。 我有时间。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Oh, hi Amber. Yes. Fine.

content.cn_text: 我之前和你提起的是位于达克兰区的河畔中介。我现在把地址告诉你——它位于东区497号。
content.en_text: So the agency I was talking about is called Bankside - they're based in Docklands - I can tell you the address now - 497 Eastside.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：好的，谢谢了。那我去了之后应该专门找谁吗？
content.en_text: AMBER: OK, thanks. So is there anyone in particular I should speak to there?

content.cn_text: 威廉：贝基·杰米逊是经常和我打交道的中介。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: The agent I always deal with is called Becky Jamieson.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：让我记一下——贝基……
content.en_text: AMBER: Let me write that down - Becky …

content.cn_text: 威廉：杰米逊，拼写作J-A-M-I-E-S-O-N。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Jamieson J-A-M-I-E-S-O-N.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：你有她的直线电话吗？
content.en_text: AMBER: Do you have her direct line?

content.cn_text: 威廉：有的，在我联络簿的哪一页记着呢。找到了，电话是：078 66 510 333。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Yes, it's in my contacts somewhere - right, here we are: 078 double 6, 510 triple 3.

content.cn_text: 如果我是你，我下午之前不会给她打电话，因为她上午一直忙着要给那些最后一刻才确定下来的空闲岗位安排员工。
content.en_text: I wouldn't call her until the afternoon if I were you - she's always really busy in the morning trying to fill last-minute vacancies.

content.cn_text: 她乐于助人，对人亲切。所以我确定联系上她和她随便聊聊也是值得的。
content.en_text: She's really helpful and friendly so I'm sure it would be worth getting in touch with her for an informal chat.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：他们主要帮忙招聘办公室文员和行政工作人员是吗？
content.en_text: AMBER: It's mainly clerical and admin jobs they deal with, isn't it?

content.cn_text: 威廉：是的。我知道你最终还是希望找一份媒体行业的全职工作。但是贝基招聘的大多是金融领域的兼职者。这样的工作能为你的简历添彩，报酬通常也更高。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: That's right. I know you're hoping to find a full-time job in the media eventually - but Becky mostly recruits temporary staff for the finance sector - which will look good on your CV - and generally pays better too.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：是的。我只是有点儿担心，因为我没怎么在办公室工作过。
content.en_text: AMBER: Yeah - I'm just a bit worried because I don't have much office experience.

content.cn_text: 威廉：我就不担心这个。他们很有可能先安排你做前台，或者类似的工作。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: I wouldn't worry. They'll probably start you as a receptionist, or something like that.

content.cn_text: 因此，这类工作看中的不是丰富的商业技巧或者各类电脑系统的操作知识。真正重要的是交流能力。你肯定会做得很好。
content.en_text: So what's important for that kind of job isn't so much having business skills or knowing lots of different computer systems - it's communication that really matters - so you'd be fine there.

content.cn_text: 而且工作的时候你会迅速掌握办公技巧。
content.en_text: And you'll pick up office skills really quickly on the job.

content.cn_text: 没有那么复杂。
content.en_text: It's not that complicated.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：好的，那就好。那企业通常需要兼职员工在岗多长时间？
content.en_text: AMBER: OK good. So how long do people generally need temporary staff for?

content.cn_text: 如果我的工作能持续至少一个月就好了。
content.en_text: It would be great if I could get something lasting at least a month.

content.cn_text: 威廉：这应该不是什么难事。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: That shouldn't be too difficult.

content.cn_text: 但是一开始给你的工作很可能只有一星期，在岗时间可能会延长。
content.en_text: But you're more likely to be offered something for a week at first, which might get extended.

content.cn_text: 只是一两天的派遣不太常见。
content.en_text: It's unusual to be sent somewhere for just a day or two.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：了解了。我听说薪水不是很糟糕，要比在商店或者饭店兼职高一些。
content.en_text: AMBER: Right. I've heard the pay isn't too bad - better than working in a shop or a restaurant.

content.cn_text: 威廉：是的，肯定的。时薪大约是10英镑，如果运气好的话，可以到11英镑。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Oh yes - definitely. The hourly rate is about £10, 11 if you're lucky.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：那还不错。我原来只想着时薪到8、9英镑就不错了。
content.en_text: AMBER: That's pretty good. I was only expecting to get eight or nine pounds an hour.

content.cn_text: 威廉：你需要我告诉你关于注册流程的事儿吗？
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Do you want me to tell you anything about the registration process?

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：是的，你请讲。我知道得有一个面试。
content.en_text: AMBER: Yes, please. I know you have to have an interview.

content.cn_text: 威廉：面试通常需要一小时，你得提前一周安排。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: The interview usually takes about an hour and you should arrange that about a week in advance.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：我猜如果是办公室工作的面试的话我得穿得得体一些。也许我要和我妈妈借套西装。
content.en_text: AMBER: I suppose I should dress smartly if it's for office work - I can probably borrow a suit from Mum.

content.cn_text: 威廉：这是个好主意。讲究总比随意好。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Good idea. It's better to look too smart than too casual.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：考试证书或者其他文件需要一起带去吗？
content.en_text: AMBER: Will I need to bring copies of my exam certificates or anything like that?

content.cn_text: 威廉：不用，他们不需要看这些。我觉得不用带。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: No - they don't need to see those, I don't think.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：那要带护照吗？
content.en_text: AMBER: What about my passport?

content.cn_text: 威廉：哦，是的，这个他们要看。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Oh yes - they will ask to see that.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：好的。
content.en_text: AMBER: OK.

content.cn_text: 威廉：我就不会为了面试紧张。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: I wouldn't get stressed about the interview though.

content.cn_text: 这只是他们和你建立关系的一个机会，这样他们才能试着给你安排你心仪的工作。
content.en_text: It's just a chance for them to build a relationship with you - so they can try and match you to a job which you'll like.

content.cn_text: 所以他们经常问应征者一些常见的，关于个性的问题。
content.en_text: So there are questions about personality that they always ask candidates - fairly basic ones.

content.cn_text: 而且他们不太可能会问你像是“你的未来规划是什么”这样刁钻的问题。
content.en_text: And they probably won't ask anything too difficult like what your plans are for the future.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：希望不会。
content.en_text: AMBER: Hope not.

content.cn_text: 威廉：无论如何，用中介还是有很多好处的。比如说，面试会对你很有帮助，因为你可以通过他们对你的表现的反馈来提高自己。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Anyway, there are lots of benefits to using an agency - for example, the interview will be useful because they'll give you feedback on your performance so you can improve next time.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：而且他们还有那些没有招聘广告的工作的门路。
content.en_text: AMBER: And they'll have access to jobs which aren't advertised.

content.cn_text: 威廉：确实，很多兼职工作都不打广告。
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Exactly - most temporary jobs aren't advertised.

content.cn_text: 艾梅伯：我希望这样找兼职能够更高效，这比给各个公司打电话省事多了。
content.en_text: AMBER: And I expect finding a temporary job this way takes a lot less time - it's much easier than ringing up individual companies.

content.cn_text: 威廉：那确实。我觉得……
content.en_text: WILLIAM: Yes indeed. Well I think …

content.cn_text: 早上好。我叫艾丽卡·马修斯。我现在正在经营由我父母创办的马修斯岛屿假日酒店。
content.en_text: Good morning. My name's Erica Matthews, and I'm the owner of Matthews Island Holidays, a company set up by my parents.

content.cn_text: 感谢您的光临，我希望展示中呈现的我们提供的服务能引起您的兴趣与关注。
content.en_text: Thank you for coming to this presentation, in which I hope to interest you in what we have to offer.

content.cn_text: 作为一家小型的家族企业，我们坚信个性化品质至关重要，因此我们不想和其他企业在客户人数上一争高低。
content.en_text: We're a small, family-run company, and we believe in the importance of the personal touch, so we don't aim to compete with other companies on the number of customers.

content.cn_text: 我们的经验几乎比其他任意一家铁路假日公司都要多。基于多年经验，确保就我们了如指掌的，为数不多的目的地，为客户提供完美假日活动。
content.en_text: What we do is build on our many years' experience - more than almost any other rail holiday company - to ensure we provide perfect holidays in a small number of destinations, which we've got to know extremely well.

content.cn_text: 我先给您介绍为期六天的马恩岛假日活动。
content.en_text: I'll start with our six-day Isle of Man holiday.

content.cn_text: 这座美丽的岛屿坐落在爱尔兰海中，南临威尔士，东接英格兰，北靠苏格兰，西临北爱尔兰。
content.en_text: This is a fascinating island in the Irish Sea, with Wales to the south, England to the east, Scotland to the north and Northern Ireland to the west.

content.cn_text: 您的旅行负责人会在希舍姆和您汇合，我们的假日也从这里开始。紧接着，您将乘坐渡轮前往马恩岛。
content.en_text: Our holiday starts in Heysham, where your tour manager will meet you, then you'll travel by ferry to the Isle of Man.

content.cn_text: 有的旅客更习惯从卢顿乘飞机出发。另一个受游客青睐的选择是乘火车到利物浦再从那里坐轮渡。
content.en_text: Some people prefer to fly from Luton instead, and another popular option is to go by train to Liverpool and take a ferry from there.

content.cn_text: 您会在酒店度过五晚。五天的早晚餐无需另付费。我们组织的三天旅行包含午餐。第四天您可以自由活动，大多数游客会在道格拉斯的餐厅或者咖啡厅享用午餐。
content.en_text: You have five nights in the hotel, and the price covers five breakfasts and dinners, and lunch on the three days when there are organised trips: day four is free, and most people have lunch in a café or restaurant in Douglas.

content.cn_text: 假日活动的价格包含前往马恩岛的轮渡、岛上所有交通、住宿和我刚才提到的餐食。
content.en_text: The price of the holiday includes the ferry to the Isle of Man, all travel on the island, the hotel, and the meals I've mentioned.

content.cn_text: 顺便提一下，我们尽力使预定流程简单明了。因此，和其他公司不同，无论您是提前六个月预定还是在预订截止前一分钟下单，价格都是一样的。而且酒店的单人房间不加价。
content.en_text: Incidentally, we try to make booking our holidays as simple and fair as possible, so unlike with many companies, the price is the same whether you book six months in advance or at the last minute, and there's no supplement for single rooms in hotels.

content.cn_text: 若预定之后需要更改出行日期，比如因病不能出行，您只需支付小额的行政费，便可以更改到其他日期或者选择另外的旅行路线。
content.en_text: If you make a booking then need to change the start date, for example because of illness, you're welcome to change to an alternative date or a different tour, for a small administrative fee.

content.cn_text: 好了，我们的假日活动包含哪些内容呢？
content.en_text: OK, so what does the holiday consist of?

content.cn_text: 第一天，旅行负责人将在您到达时为您简单介绍行程，接着您回到酒店享用晚餐。
content.en_text: Well, on day one you'll arrive in time for a short introduction by your tour manager, followed by dinner in the hotel.

content.cn_text: 餐厅面朝河流，靠近港口。港口上经常有许多活动。
content.en_text: The dining room looks out at the river, close to where it flows into the harbour, and there's usually plenty of activity going on.

content.cn_text: 第二天，您将乘车前往皮尔小镇，途中可以参观提恩沃德展览。
content.en_text: On day two you'll take the coach to the small town of Peel, on the way calling in at the Tynwald Exhibition.

content.cn_text: 马恩岛并不是英国的一部分，它有自己的议会，叫作提恩沃德。
content.en_text: The Isle of Man isn't part of the United Kingdom, and it has its own parliament, called Tynwald.

content.cn_text: 马恩岛议会可以追溯至979年，是世界上最古老的、仍在运行的议会。
content.en_text: It's claimed that this is the world's oldest parliament that's still functioning, and that it dates back to 979.

content.cn_text: 但是，现存最早关于它的文献记录出现在1422年，因此，也许它并没有传说的那么古老。
content.en_text: However, the earliest surviving reference to it is from 1422, so perhaps it isn't quite as old as it claims!

content.cn_text: 第三天我们会出发去斯奈菲尔山。
content.en_text: Day three we have a trip to the mountain Snaefell.

content.cn_text: 当天早上，我们可以沿着道格拉斯的散步长廊乘坐马拉车，打发一段悠闲的时光。
content.en_text: This begins with a leisurely ride along the promenade in Douglas in a horse-drawn tram.

content.cn_text: 接着，乘坐电气火车前往拉克西的渔村。
content.en_text: Then you board an electric train which takes you to the fishing village of Laxey.

content.cn_text: 在那里乘坐总长为8千米的登山铁路到达山顶。
content.en_text: From there it's an eight-kilometre ride in the Snaefell Mountain Railway to the top.

content.cn_text: 在咖啡厅中享用午餐，您可以享受小岛上秀美的景色。
content.en_text: Lunch will be in the café, giving you spectacular views of the island.

content.cn_text: 第四天您可以使用我们提供的门票自行参观游玩。
content.en_text: Day four is free for you to explore, using the pass which we'll give you.

content.cn_text: 因此，您无需再支付当地的交通费或者购买参观小岛上遗址的门票。
content.en_text: So you won't have to pay for travel on local transport, or for entrance to the island's heritage sites.

content.cn_text: 或许您可能只想在道格拉斯度过一段轻松的时光，也许只想购购物，消磨时光。
content.en_text: Or you might just want to take it easy in Douglas and perhaps do a little light shopping.

content.cn_text: 最后一天，也就是第五天，对某些游客来说也是假日最精彩的部分，他们可以乘坐蒸汽火车从道格拉斯出发前往艾琳港口。
content.en_text: The last full day, day five, is for some people the highlight of the holiday, with a ride on the steam railway, from Douglas to Port Erin.

content.cn_text: 一番游玩之后，您将乘车前往海岬，在那里可以眺望岸边的一座小岛——小马恩岛。
content.en_text: After some time to explore, a coach will take you to the headland that overlooks the Calf of Man, a small island just off the coast.

content.cn_text: 从那里您继续向马恩岛曾经的首都——卡斯尔敦行进参观当地的中世纪古堡。
content.en_text: From there you continue to Castletown, which used to be the capital of the Isle of Man, and its medieval castle.

content.cn_text: 第六天您将返程前往轮渡码头，如果您之前是乘飞机到达的，则去机场。是时候回家了。
content.en_text: And on day six it's back to the ferry - or the airport, if you flew to the island - and time to go home.

content.cn_text: 现在我想告诉您的是……
content.en_text: Now I'd like to tell you ...

questions.answer_content: has been in business for longer than most of its competitors.

content.cn_text: 露丝：艾德，和我们下周的展示有关的阅读材料看得怎么样了？
content.en_text: RUTH: Ed, how are you getting on with the reading for our presentation next week?

content.cn_text: 艾德：进行得很顺利，露丝。但是材料太多了。
content.en_text: ED: Well, OK, Ruth - but there's so much of it.

content.cn_text: 露丝：我知道，我从没想过出生顺序会是大热的研究领域。
content.en_text: RUTH: I know, I hadn't realised birth order was such a popular area of research.

content.cn_text: 艾德：但是关于出生顺序和个性的研究多是不可靠的。
content.en_text: ED: But the stuff on birth order and personality is mostly unreliable.

content.cn_text: 我读到的很多关于人的家庭位置决定性格特征的陈述只是刻板印象，缺少有力证据的支撑。
content.en_text: From what I've been reading a lot of the claims about how your position in the family determines certain personality traits are just stereotypes, with no robust evidence to support them.

content.cn_text: 露丝：是的，但是这是很有趣的观点。我们可以先概括之前的研究数据。
content.en_text: RUTH: OK, but that's an interesting point - we could start by outlining what previous research has shown.

content.cn_text: 早在一百年前就有相关的研究。
content.en_text: There are studies going back over a hundred years.

content.cn_text: 艾德：是的，那么我们可以介绍一些典型的个性特征。
content.en_text: ED: Yeah - so we could just run through some of the typical traits.

content.cn_text: 就像是研究者达成共识，认为最年长的孩子通常适应性更差，因为他们一直对家中更小的孩子的出生难以释怀。
content.en_text: Like the consensus seems to be that oldest children are generally less well-adjusted because they never get over the arrival of a younger sibling.

content.cn_text: 露丝：是的，但是从积极方面来说，一些研究认为这些孩子更擅长养育。当然了，在过去当家里人口较多的时候，家长总是期望最年长的孩子照顾弟弟妹妹。
content.en_text: RUTH: Right, but on a positive note, some studies claimed that they were thought to be good at nurturing - certainly in the past when people had large families they would have been expected to look after the younger ones.

content.cn_text: 艾德：关于年龄在中间段的孩子的描述却不明确。但是许多研究提到的一点特征是这些孩子比年长或年幼的兄弟姐妹更容易相处。
content.en_text: ED: There isn't such a clear picture for middle children - but one trait that a lot of the studies mention is that they are easier to get on with than older or younger siblings.

content.cn_text: 露丝：他们通常渴望取悦和帮助其他人——尽管从我自己家来看这点确实不准确，我的中间年龄段的哥哥简直是我的噩梦，一直以来挑衅和我打架而且不管我有什么他都会嫉妒。
content.en_text: RUTH: Generally eager to please and helpful - although that's certainly not accurate as far as my family goes - my middle brother was a nightmare - always causing fights and envious of whatever I had.

content.cn_text: 艾德：正如我所说，这些看起来都和我自己的经历不一致。
content.en_text: ED: As I said - none of this seems to relate to my own experience.

content.cn_text: 我是我们家最小的孩子，我认为我的情况和我读到的任何一篇研究的叙述都不一样。
content.en_text: I'm the youngest in my family and I don't recognise myself in any of the studies I've read about.

content.cn_text: 从研究来看我应该是一个既友善又自信的，可以轻易交到朋友的人。但是事实上我却特别害羞。
content.en_text: I'm supposed to have been a sociable and confident child who made friends easily - but I was actually terribly shy.

content.cn_text: 露丝：真的吗？好奇怪。
content.en_text: RUTH: Really? That's funny.

content.cn_text: 有数百篇关于双胞胎的研究，但是大部分研究的都是后期养育和天性的关系。
content.en_text: There have been hundreds of studies on twins but mostly about nurture versus nature …

content.cn_text: 艾德：有一篇关于个性的研究认为双胞胎在社交活动中更容易十分害羞，主要是因为他们经常在一起，可以互相支持互相依靠。
content.en_text: ED: There was one on personality, which said that a twin is likely to be quite shy in social situations because they always have their twin around to depend on for support.

content.cn_text: 露丝：我的堂兄们小的时候就是这样的，他们只对对方的事情感兴趣，认为和其他孩子打交道很难。
content.en_text: RUTH: My cousins were like that when they were small - they were only interested in each other and found it hard to engage with other kids.

content.cn_text: 不过他们现在还不错。
content.en_text: They're fine now though.

content.cn_text: 艾德：对独生子的评价并不乐观。许多研究给他们贴上了不合群的标签。因为他们从不需要通过和其他孩子竞争来获得父母的关注，所以他们认为自己是世界的中心。
content.en_text: ED: Only children have had a really bad press - a lot of studies have branded them as loners who think the world revolves around them because they've never had to fight for their parents' attention.

content.cn_text: 露丝：这么说有一点过分了。
content.en_text: RUTH: That does seem a bit harsh.

content.cn_text: 我之前没有考虑过的类别是哥哥姐姐比自己大得多的孩子。有不少研究提到这些孩子成长很快，父母们期待他们能自己做一些像是穿衣服这样的简单的事。
content.en_text: One category I hadn't considered before was children with much older siblings - a couple of studies mentioned that these children grow up more quickly and are expected to do basic things for themselves - like getting dressed.

content.cn_text: 艾德：我能理解，这也许是真的。尽管有些时候我认为事实恰恰相反，我以为他们扮演着小孩子的角色，大吵大闹地要求父母特别的照顾。
content.en_text: ED: I can see how that might be true - although I expect they're sometimes the exact opposite - playing the baby role and clamouring for special treatment.

content.cn_text: 露丝：你觉得大多数研究的问题是什么？
content.en_text: RUTH: What was the problem with most of these studies, do you think?

content.cn_text: 艾德：我认为许多实例数据来自于每个家庭中的某个子女，他们评价自己的同时也评价了其他兄弟姐妹。
content.en_text: ED: I think it was because in a lot of cases data was collected from only one sibling per family, who rated him or herself and his or her siblings at the same time.

content.cn_text: 露丝：唔。但是，事实证明一些早期研究关于出生顺序和学习成绩的关系的调查是准确的。
content.en_text: RUTH: Mmm. Some of the old research into the relationship between birth order and academic achievement has been proved to be accurate though.

content.cn_text: 从老大到弟弟妹妹，智力测试呈现轻微的下降趋势。许多近期的研究都证明了这一点。
content.en_text: Performances in intelligence tests decline slightly from the eldest child to his or her younger siblings. This has been proved in lots of recent studies.

content.cn_text: 艾德：是的，虽然许多研究没有将家庭人数考虑在内。
content.en_text: ED: Yes. Although what many of them didn't take into consideration was family size.

content.cn_text: 一个家庭中孩子越多，它的社会经济地位就可能越低。这也是造成兄弟姐妹间的学习成绩差异的原因。
content.en_text: The more siblings there are, the likelier the family is to have a low socioeconomic status - which can also account for differences between siblings in academic performance.

content.cn_text: 露丝：比如，最大的男孩得到的机会比他的妹妹们更多。
content.en_text: RUTH: The oldest boy might be given more opportunities than his younger sisters, for example.

content.cn_text: 艾德：正是。
content.en_text: ED: Exactly.

content.cn_text: 露丝：但是我觉得最年长孩子获得稍高的学习成绩的主要原因十分让人吃惊。
content.en_text: RUTH: But the main reason for the marginally higher academic performance of oldest children is quite surprising, I think.

content.cn_text: 这不只是因为少年时得到的父母的额外关注帮助了他们智力的发展——这一点是我本来以为的。
content.en_text: It's not only that they benefit intellectually from extra attention at a young age - which is what I would have expected.

content.cn_text: 真正的原因是他们是弟弟妹妹的老师，用丰富的话语表达指令。
content.en_text: It's that they benefit from being teachers for their younger siblings, by verbalising processes.

content.cn_text: 艾德：对的。这也塑造了他们的地位和自信。这些品质再次慢慢地提高了他们的成绩。
content.en_text: ED: Right, and this gives them status and confidence, which again contribute, in a small way, to better performance.

content.cn_text: 那么你觉得对你来说兄弟姊妹间的竞争是有帮助的吗？
content.en_text: So would you say sibling rivalry has been a useful thing for you?

content.cn_text: 露丝：我觉得是，我的弟弟特别讨厌，我们常常打架。但是我认为这样使我变得更强大了。
content.en_text: RUTH: I think so - my younger brother was incredibly annoying and we fought a lot but I think this has made me a stronger person.

content.cn_text: 我知道如何保护我自己。
content.en_text: I know how to defend myself.

content.cn_text: 我们曾经吵得很厉害，我宁愿去死也不愿意给他道歉。但是，我们必须忍受对方，大多数时间我们相处得很好。
content.en_text: We had some terrible arguments and I would have died rather than apologise to him - but we had to put up with each other and most of the time we co-existed amicably enough.

content.cn_text: 艾德：我的情况也很类似。
content.en_text: ED: Yes, my situation was pretty similar.

content.cn_text: 但是我觉得我的两个哥哥没有让我更无私，我从不让他们用我的东西。
content.en_text: But I don't think having two older brothers made me any less selfish - I was never prepared to let my brothers use any of my stuff …

content.cn_text: 露丝：这种情况特别常见，但是……
content.en_text: RUTH: That's perfectly normal, whereas …

a middle child

What do the speakers say about the evidence relating to birth order and academicsuccess?
questions.answer_content: Some studies have neglected to include important factors such as family size.

questions.title: What does Ruth think is surprising about the difference in oldest children's academic performance?
questions.answer_content: It is mainly thanks to their roles as teachers for their younger siblings.
learning to stand up for oneself

content.cn_text: 今天我要讲的是桉树。
content.en_text: Today I'm going to talk about the eucalyptus tree.

content.cn_text: 这种树在澳大利亚很常见，当地人称它作胶树。
content.en_text: This is a very common tree here in Australia, where it's also sometimes called the gum tree.

content.cn_text: 首先，我要讲一下它的重要性，接着我会陈述目前这种植物遇到的问题。
content.en_text: First I'm going to talk about why it's important, then I'm going to describe some problems it faces at present.

content.cn_text: 好的，桉树的重要性体现在很多方面。
content.en_text: Right, well the eucalyptus tree is an important tree for lots of reasons.

content.cn_text: 比如，它为鸟类和蝙蝠提供庇护所，这些动物和其他物种都以它为食，尤其是桉树花朵中的花蜜。
content.en_text: For example, it gives shelter to creatures like birds and bats, and these and other species also depend on it for food, particularly the nectar from its flowers.

content.cn_text: 所以，桉树维持了物种的多样性。
content.en_text: So it supports biodiversity.

content.cn_text: 桉树对人类也有帮助，因为我们需要用桉树叶中提取的油来制作杀死细菌的消毒剂。
content.en_text: It's useful to us humans too, because we can kill germs with a disinfectant made from oil extracted from eucalyptus leaves.

content.cn_text: 桉树遍布澳洲，最长可以存活400年。
content.en_text: The eucalyptus grows all over Australia and the trees can live for up to four hundred years.

content.cn_text: 因此让人担忧的是，全澳洲的桉树数量在下降，因为这些树木正在过早地死亡。
content.en_text: So it's alarming that all across the country, numbers of eucalyptus are falling because the trees are dying off prematurely.

content.cn_text: 那么是什么原因呢？
content.en_text: So what are the reasons for this?

content.cn_text: 疾病可能是一个原因。
content.en_text: One possible reason is disease.

content.cn_text: 早在20世纪70年代，桉树就开始得了杜蒙拉黄叶病。
content.en_text: As far back as the 1970s the trees started getting a disease called Mundulla Yellows.

content.cn_text: 桉树的树叶逐渐变黄，最终死亡。
content.en_text: The trees' leaves would gradually turn yellow, then the tree would die.

content.cn_text: 直到2004年，专家才发现修路时用到的建筑材料石灰——化学学名为氢氧化钙，是致病的原因。
content.en_text: It wasn't until 2004 that they found the cause of the problem was lime, or calcium hydroxide to give it its proper chemical name, which was being used in the construction of roads.

content.cn_text: 石灰经雨水冲刷进入地下，影响了附近桉树的树根。
content.en_text: The lime was being washed away into the ground and affecting the roots of the eucalyptus trees nearby.

content.cn_text: 石灰阻碍桉树树根吸收对它的健康成长很重要的铁元素。
content.en_text: What it was doing was preventing the trees from sucking up the iron they needed for healthy growth.

content.cn_text: 当铁元素被注入受影响的树的时候，这些桉树马上恢复了。
content.en_text: When this was injected back into the affected trees, they immediately recovered.

content.cn_text: 但是石灰只影响到了相当小的一部分桉树。
content.en_text: But this problem only affected a relatively small number of trees.

content.cn_text: 截止2000年，澳洲东海岸的桉树大量死亡，病因是矿吸蜜鸟关联性枯萎病。
content.en_text: By 2000, huge numbers of eucalyptus were dying along Australia's East Coast, of a disease known as Bell-miner Associated Die-back.

content.cn_text: 这种病在矿吸蜜鸟数量庞大的地区似乎尤其普遍。
content.en_text: The bell-miner is a bird, and the disease seems to be common where there are high populations of bell-miners.

content.cn_text: 同样，受影响的是树叶。
content.en_text: Again it's the leaves of the trees that are affected.

content.cn_text: 桉树树叶上的昆虫会把它周围的树叶啃光，边移动边破坏树叶，同时还会分泌一种含糖的液体。
content.en_text: What happens is that insects settle on the leaves and eat their way round them, destroying them as they go, and at the same time they secrete a solution which has sugar in it.

content.cn_text: 矿吸蜜鸟十分喜食这种溶液。为了尽可能多得获得食物，它们会驱散其他可能尝试觅食的物种。
content.en_text: The bellminer birds really like this solution, and in order to get as much as possible, they keep away other creatures that might try to get it.

content.cn_text: 所以矿吸蜜鸟和昆虫在影响其它物种的生存的情况下疯狂繁殖，最终严重破坏了树叶，导致桉树死亡。
content.en_text: So these birds and insects flourish at the expense of other species, and eventually so much damage is done to the leaves that the tree dies.

content.cn_text: 然而专家认为在出现矿吸蜜鸟关联枯萎病的迹象之前，桉树早已开始呈现病态。
content.en_text: But experts say that trees can start looking sick before any sign of Bell-miner Associated Dieback.

content.cn_text: 因此，看起来这个问题也许有其它的解释。
content.en_text: So it looks as if the problem might have another explanation.

content.cn_text: 另一个可能的原因与澳大利亚的巨大丛林山火有关。
content.en_text: One possibility is that it's to do with the huge bushfires that we have in Australia.

content.cn_text: 生态学家威廉·杰克逊于40年前提出了这样的理论，说明特定地区的频繁丛林山火影响了当地的植被种类。
content.en_text: A theory proposed over 40 years ago by ecologist William Jackson is that the frequency of bushfires in a particular region affects the type of vegetation that grows there.

content.cn_text: 如果某个地区山火非常频繁，丛林山火结束后草会得到养料，迅速生长。但是如果山火频率降低，桉树会迅速生长。
content.en_text: If there are very frequent bushfires in a region, this encourages grass to grow afterwards, while if the bushfires are rather less frequent, this results in the growth of eucalyptus forests.

content.cn_text: 为什么呢？为什么相对频繁的丛林山火会促进桉树的生长呢？
content.en_text: So why is this? Why do fairly frequent bushfires actually support the growth of eucalyptus?

content.cn_text: 一个原因是丛林山火阻止了其他与桉树争抢水源的物种的增加。
content.en_text: Well, one reason is that the fire stops the growth of other species which would consume water needed by eucalyptus trees.

content.cn_text: 还有一个原因。
content.en_text: And there's another reason.

content.cn_text: 如果其他生长期短的灌木和植物大量生长，会从另一个角度影响桉树——它们会吸收土壤养分，破坏土壤成分。
content.en_text: If these other quick-growing species of bushes and plants are allowed to proliferate, they harm the eucalyptus in another way, by affecting the composition of the soil, and removing nutrients from it.

content.cn_text: 事实上，只要发生频率不是特别高，丛林山火其实可以保护桉树的生存。
content.en_text: So some bushfires are actually essential for the eucalyptus to survive as long as they are not too frequent.

content.cn_text: 实际上，有证据显示澳大利亚土著居民在欧洲人到达前的数千年中经常有规律地烧荒。
content.en_text: In fact there's evidence that Australia's indigenous people practised regular burning of bush land for thousands of years before the arrival of the Europeans.

content.cn_text: 但是自从欧洲人到达澳洲，山火的数量明显被控制了。
content.en_text: But since Europeans arrived on the continent, the number of bushfires has been strictly controlled.

content.cn_text: 现在科学家们认为丛林山火频率降低形成了所谓的“干燥雨林”，这个名词听起来古怪是因为我们经常把热带雨林和它的潮湿气候联系起来。
content.en_text: Now scientists believe that this reduced frequency of bushfires to low levels has led to what's known as 'dry rainforest', which seems an odd name as usually we associate tropical rainforest with wet conditions.

content.cn_text: 那么这类雨林有什么特别之处呢？
content.en_text: And what's special about this type of rainforest?

content.cn_text: 和拥有复杂生态系统的热带雨林不同，这类干燥雨林只有一个简单的生态系统。
content.en_text: Well, unlike tropical rainforest which is a rich ecosystem, this type of ecosystem is usually a simple one.

content.cn_text: 在这里植物茂盛繁密，但是生物物种却不多。
content.en_text: It has very thick, dense vegetation, but not much variety of species.

content.cn_text: 植被提供了树荫，所以有一种找到了理想住所的物种，那就是矿吸蜜鸟。它们把巢搭在生长在大树之下的灌木之中。
content.en_text: The vegetation provides lots of shade, so one species that does find it ideal is the bell-miner bird, which builds its nests in the undergrowth there.

content.cn_text: 但是这对桉树也没有帮助。
content.en_text: But again that's not helpful for the eucalyptus tree.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：早上好。这里是游客信息中心，我是蒂姆。
content.en_text: TIM: Good morning. You're through to the tourist information office, Tim speaking.

content.cn_text: 有什么可以帮到您？
content.en_text: How can I help you?

content.cn_text: 基恩：你好。请问你可以告诉我一些关于下个月的庆典活动的信息吗？
content.en_text: JEAN: Oh hello. Could you give me some information about next month's festival, please?

content.cn_text: 那周我和我的家人会在镇上。
content.en_text: My family and I will be staying in the town that week.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：当然可以。庆典的第一场活动是在17号下午举行的演唱会。
content.en_text: TIM: Of course. Well it starts with a concert on the afternoon of the 17th.

content.cn_text: 基恩：我听说过。
content.en_text: JEAN: Oh I heard about that.

content.cn_text: 歌手和乐队都是来自美国对吗？
content.en_text: The orchestra and singers come from the USA, don't they?

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：他们来自加拿大。是当地特别受欢迎的音乐家。
content.en_text: TIM: They're from Canada. They're very popular over there.

content.cn_text: 他们将要表演许多著名作品。大人和孩子都特别喜欢。
content.en_text: They're going to perform a number of well-known pieces that will appeal to children as well as adults.

content.cn_text: 基恩：听起来不错。我们全家人都很喜欢音乐。
content.en_text: JEAN: That sounds good. My whole family are interested in music.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：第二天，也就是18号会有一场由尤塞缇丝的芭蕾舞团呈现的演出。
content.en_text: TIM: The next day, the 18th, there's a performance by a ballet company called Eustatis.

content.cn_text: 基恩：不好意思，叫什么？
content.en_text: JEAN: Sorry?

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：名字拼写作E-U-S-T-A-T-I-S。
content.en_text: TIM: The name is spelt E-U-S-T-A-T-I-S.

content.cn_text: 他们去年也来了，节目很受欢迎。
content.en_text: They appeared in last year's festival, and went down very well.

content.cn_text: 同样的，他们的节目也是老少皆宜。
content.en_text: Again, their programme is designed for all ages.

content.cn_text: 基恩：好的。我希望也能去看看。
content.en_text: JEAN: Good. I expect we'll go to that.

content.cn_text: 我希望庆典中能有一场戏剧表演，最好是喜剧。
content.en_text: I hope there's going to be a play during the festival, a comedy, ideally.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：你走运了。 19号和20号会有两场由当地业余剧团表演的戏剧，剧本是剧团的一个成员写的。
content.en_text: TIM: You're in luck! On the 19th and 20th a local amateur group are performing one written by a member of the group.

content.cn_text: 戏剧的名字叫做《杰米玛》。他们会在市政厅表演。
content.en_text: It's called Jemima. That'll be on in the town hall.

content.cn_text: 之前已经表演了两三次了。
content.en_text: They've already performed it two or three times.

content.cn_text: 我自己没有看过，但是本地报纸对它评价很高。
content.en_text: I haven't seen it myself, but the review in the local paper was very good.

content.cn_text: 基恩：适合孩子看嘛？
content.en_text: JEAN: And is it suitable for children?

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：是的。事实上，比起大人，孩子才是他们的目标观众，所以两场表演都在下午。
content.en_text: TIM: Yes, in fact it's aimed more at children than at adults, so both performances are in the afternoon.

content.cn_text: 基恩：舞蹈呢？会有舞蹈表演吗？
content.en_text: JEAN: And what about dance? Will there be any performances?

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：是的，也是在20号，但是在晚上。
content.en_text: TIM: Yes, also on the 20th, but in the evening.

content.cn_text: 一家专业舞蹈团将会表演几支现代舞，伴奏用的是年轻作曲家写的电子音乐。
content.en_text: A professional company is putting on a show of modern pieces, with electronic music by young composers.

content.cn_text: 基恩：嗯嗯。
content.en_text: JEAN: Uh-huh.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：表演的核心是展现人们如何沟通或者交流失败的。所以它有一个奇怪的名字，《聊天》。
content.en_text: TIM: The show is about how people communicate, or fail to communicate, with each other, so it's got the rather strange name, Chat.

content.cn_text: 基恩：我想那是因为聊天是我们上网或者面对面都会做的事情吧。
content.en_text: JEAN: I suppose that's because that's something we do both face to face and online.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：是的。
content.en_text: TIM: That's right.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：另外还有一些工作坊和其他活动。
content.en_text: TIM: Now there are also some workshops and other activities.

content.cn_text: 每天至少举行一次活动，所以任何想要参加的人都有机会。
content.en_text: They'll all take place at least once every day, so everyone who wants to take part will have a chance.

content.cn_text: 基恩：好的。我们对烹饪特别感兴趣。兴许碰巧有一些烹饪工作坊，会吗？
content.en_text: JEAN: Good. We're particularly interested in cookery - you don't happen to have a cookery workshop, do you?

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：确实有。这个工作坊将会关注如何将食物变成健康生活方式的一部分，展现了哪怕是像蛋糕这样的甜食也可以少含糖。
content.en_text: TIM: We certainly do. It's going to focus on how to make food part of a healthy lifestyle, and it'll show that even sweet things like cakes can contain much less sugar than they usually do.

content.cn_text: 基恩：也许值得一去。
content.en_text: JEAN: That might be worth going to.

content.cn_text: 我们正尝试着鼓励家里的孩子做饭。
content.en_text: We're trying to encourage our children to cook.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：另一个工作坊也是关于孩子的。它教会孩子如何制作反映小镇历史的海报。
content.en_text: TIM: Another workshop is just for children, and that's on creating posters to reflect the history of the town.

content.cn_text: 课程的目标是让孩子了解数百年来小镇和人们生活的变化。
content.en_text: The aim is to make children aware of how both the town and people's lives have changed over the centuries.

content.cn_text: 作品会在交流中心展出。
content.en_text: The results will be exhibited in the community centre.

content.cn_text: 还有一个工作坊是制作玩具的，但是只对大人开放。
content.en_text: Then the other workshop is in toy-making, and that's for adults only.

content.cn_text: 基恩：为什么呢？
content.en_text: JEAN: Oh, why's that?

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：因为涉及到木工活，参与者用木头制作玩具，所以会有许多尖锐的凿子和其他工具。
content.en_text: TIM: Because it involves carpentry - participants will be making toys out of wood, so there'll be a lot of sharp chisels and other tools around.

content.cn_text: 基恩：不让孩子参与是有道理的。
content.en_text: JEAN: It makes sense to keep children away from it.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：确实。现在让我给你介绍一些户外活动吧。
content.en_text: TIM: Exactly. Now let me tell you about some of the outdoor activities.

content.cn_text: 包括有专人指导的野泳……
content.en_text: There'll be supervised wild swimming …

content.cn_text: 基恩：野泳？什么意思？
content.en_text: JEAN: Wild swimming? What's that?

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：意思是在自然水域而不是游泳池游泳。
content.en_text: TIM: It just means swimming in natural waters, rather than a swimming pool.

content.cn_text: 基恩：哦，好吧，比如在湖里。
content.en_text: JEAN: Oh OK. In a lake, for instance.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：是的，是在小镇之外的一个美丽的湖泊，那里会有游泳场地。
content.en_text: TIM: Yes, there's a beautiful one just outside the town, and that'll be the venue for the swimming.

content.cn_text: 现场还有值班的救生员，所以不论大人小孩都可以去。
content.en_text: There'll be lifeguards on duty, so it's suitable for all ages.

content.cn_text: 最后，还有在附近树林的每日漫走活动。
content.en_text: And finally, there'll be a walk in some nearby woods every day.

content.cn_text: 领路人是一位昆虫专家。
content.en_text: The leader is an expert on insects.

content.cn_text: 他会展示生活在森林中的一些昆虫，介绍它们对于环境的重要作用。
content.en_text: He'll show some that live in the woods, and how important they are for the environment.

content.cn_text: 所以整个庆典期间有各种活动可以参加。
content.en_text: So there are going to be all sorts of different things to do during the festival.

content.cn_text: 基恩：确实是。
content.en_text: JEAN: There certainly are.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：如果你想要阅读一些有关庆典的准备活动，可以看看活动组织者的博客。
content.en_text: TIM: If you'd like to read about how the preparations for the festival are going, the festival organiser is keeping a blog.

content.cn_text: 上网搜索活动网页就能看到。
content.en_text: Just search online for the festival website, and you'll find it.

content.cn_text: 基恩：好的，十分感谢你分享的信息。
content.en_text: JEAN: Well, thank you very much for all the information.

content.cn_text: 蒂姆：不客气。再见。
content.en_text: TIM: You're welcome. Goodbye.

content.cn_text: 基恩：再见。
content.en_text: JEAN: Goodbye.

content.cn_text: 女：很高兴迎来今晚的特约发言人——马克·罗根。他将为我们介绍敏斯特公园最近的变化。
content.en_text: WOMAN: I'm very pleased to welcome this evening's guest speaker, Mark Logan, who's going to tell us about the recent transformation of Minster Park.

content.cn_text: 交给你了，马克。
content.en_text: Over to you, Mark.

content.cn_text: 马克：谢谢。我相信大家已经对敏斯特公园十分熟悉了。
content.en_text: MARK: Thank you. I'm sure you're all familiar with Minster Park.

content.cn_text: 过去100年间，这座公园一直是这座城市的标志，大部分时间由市政局管理。
content.en_text: It's been a feature of the city for well over a century, and has been the responsibility of the city council for most of that time.

content.cn_text: 不为人知的一点也许就是这座公园的前身了。许多公共公园的前身是私人花园，比如，大房子的花园。和这类花园不同，敏斯特公园的前身是一片废弃的土地。1892年，附近居民开始在这里种植花草。
content.en_text: What perhaps isn't so well known is the origin of the park: unlike many public parks that started in private ownership, as the garden of a large house, for instance, Minster was some waste land, which people living nearby started planting with flowers in 1892.

content.cn_text: 人们并不确定土地的主人是谁，直到20年后，市政局接管了它，这一问题才得到解决。
content.en_text: It was unclear who actually owned the land, and this wasn't settled until 20 years later, when the council took possession of it.

content.cn_text: 你们也许已经注意到了一个入口旁的雕塑。
content.en_text: You may have noticed the statue near one of the entrances.

content.cn_text: 那是黛安·戈斯福思。她在这座公园的历史中扮演了重要的角色。
content.en_text: It's of Diane Gosforth, who played a key role in the history of the park.

content.cn_text: 市政局刚一成为这里的合法主人，就想要将它以房屋用地卖掉。
content.en_text: Once the council had become the legal owner, it planned to sell the land for housing.

content.cn_text: 许多当地居民希望将它保留为公共区域，所有人都可以到这里享受新鲜的空气和美好的自然环境——别忘了，这个公园位于人口密集的住宅区。
content.en_text: Many local people wanted it to remain a place that everyone could go to, to enjoy the fresh air and natural environment - remember the park is in a densely populated residential area.

content.cn_text: 黛安·戈斯福思就是当时的居民之一，她组织了请愿和示威游行，最终迫使议会改变了对这片土地的未来规划的决策。
content.en_text: Diane Gosforth was one of those people, and she organised petitions and demonstrations, which eventually made the council change its mind about the future of the land.

content.cn_text: 不久之后，第一次世界大战在1914年爆发了，公园的大部分都被翻整，种上了用于在当地售卖的蔬菜。
content.en_text: Soon after this the First World War broke out, in 1914, and most of the park was dug up and planted with vegetables, which were sold locally.

content.cn_text: 在某一时期，军队曾考虑过接管这个地方用于军事训练。相关事宜已经进行到与市政厅商议的环节，但是却因为这个公园面积太小而放弃了。
content.en_text: At one stage the army considered taking it over for troop exercises and got as far as contacting the city council, then decided the park was too small to be of use.

content.cn_text: 战争期间，在被保留作为草坪的区域，偶尔会举行公众集会。
content.en_text: There were occasional public meetings during the war, in an area that had been retained as grass.

content.cn_text: 战争结束后，公园大体上回归到1914年之前的样子，直至今日几乎没有改变。
content.en_text: After the war, the park was turned back more or less to how it had been before 1914, and continued almost unchanged until recently.

content.cn_text: 改造公园的计划经常被提起，最近一次是在2013年，但是在工程开始之前的2015又修订了计划。
content.en_text: Plans for transforming it were drawn up at various times, most recently in 2013, though they were revised in 2015, before any work had started.

content.cn_text: 整个修整项目在2016年得以实施，按照计划于去年完工。
content.en_text: The changes finally got going in 2016, and were finished on schedule last year.

content.cn_text: 好的，我来给你们介绍一下已经完成的改造计划，还有保留下来的部分。
content.en_text: OK, let me tell you about some of the changes that have been made - and some things that have been retained.

content.cn_text: 如果看这张地图，就会发现和公园相似的轮廓，公园北面的便是一条河，其它三面的围墙上各有一扇门。
content.en_text: If you look at this map, you'll see the familiar outline of the park, with the river forming the northern boundary, and a gate in each of the other three walls.

content.cn_text: 黛安·戈斯福思的雕塑曾被放置在不同地方：过去它紧邻南门，但是现在它就在荷塘的北面，几乎就在公园的中心，这样看起来更加显眼。
content.en_text: The statue of Diane Gosforth has been moved: it used to be close to the south gate, but it's now immediately to the north of the lily pond, almost in the centre of the park, which makes it much more visible.

content.cn_text: 公园新开辟一个区域，放置了一些木质雕塑，就在河畔上，从东门延展过来的小路在这里有个急转弯。
content.en_text: There's a new area of wooden sculptures, which are on the river bank, where the path from the east gate makes a sharp bend.

content.cn_text: 有两个区域是专门为孩子们准备的。
content.en_text: There are two areas that are particularly intended for children.

content.cn_text: 我们扩大了游乐场的面积并且完善了设施。游乐场就在河流和那条连接河流与池塘的小路中间。
content.en_text: The playground has been enlarged and improved, and that's between the river and the path that leads from the pond to the river.

content.cn_text: 另外，公园里还有一个新的迷宫，低矮的篱笆把迷宫中的层层环状小路分开。
content.en_text: Then there's a new maze, a circular series of paths, separated by low hedges.

content.cn_text: 迷宫靠近西门。从西门出发，向北边河流方向前进，然后左转就到了。
content.en_text: That's near the west gate - you go north from there towards the river and then turn left to reach it.

content.cn_text: 公园中的网球场已经存在很多年了，目前网球场的数量由四个变成了八个，增加了一倍。
content.en_text: There have been tennis courts in the park for many years, and they've been doubled, from four to eight.

content.cn_text: 网球场还是在公园的西南角，小路在那里拐了个直角弯。
content.en_text: They're still in the south-west corner of the park, where there's a right-angle bend in the path.

content.cn_text: 我还想要介绍的是新的健身区域。
content.en_text: Something else I'd like to mention is the new fitness area.

content.cn_text: 它和西门在同一侧，紧挨着荷塘。
content.en_text: This is right next to the lily pond on the same side as the west gate.

content.cn_text: 现在，因为大家都是园艺工作者，我想你们一定想要听一下被选来种在公园中的植物。
content.en_text: Now, as you're all gardeners, I'm sure you'll like to hear about the plants that have been chosen for the park.

questions.title: The park was originally established
questions.answer_content: as a shared area set up by the local community.

questions.title: Why is there a statue of Diane Gosforth in the park?
questions.answer_content: She was a resident who helped to lead a campaign.

content.cn_text: 凯西：好了，格雷汉姆，让我们来确认一下我们是否都清楚接下来应该做的事情吧。
content.en_text: CATHY: OK, Graham, so let's check we both know what we're supposed to be doing.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：好的。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: OK.

content.cn_text: 凯西：那么，为了大学的开放日，我们需要安排关于19世纪中期的英国生活和文学的展览。
content.en_text: CATHY: So, for the university's open day, we have to plan a display on British life and literature in the mid-19th century.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：对的。我们有一些能够帮助我们寻找材料和建立展览的帮手。所以记住在目前阶段，我们只需要做好计划。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: That's right. But we'll have some people to help us find the materials and set it up, remember - for the moment, we just need to plan it.

content.cn_text: 凯西：很好。你收集要来参观展览的人员名单了吗？
content.en_text: CATHY: Good. So have you gathered who's expected to come and see the display?

content.cn_text: 来的人主要是英语学习者，还是其他学院的学生？
content.en_text: Is it for the people studying English, or students from other departments?

content.cn_text: 我不是很清楚。
content.en_text: I'm not clear about it.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：我也不知道。过去是这样的，但是并没有多少人来。所以今年展览将成为开放日的一个环节，来提高大学的知名度。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: Nor me. That was how it used to be, but it didn't attract many people, so this year it's going to be part of an open day, to raise the university's profile.

content.cn_text: 在城里也会有宣传，目的是鼓励人们来参观，弄清楚这个展览究竟是什么。
content.en_text: It'll be publicised in the city, to encourage people to come and find out something of what goes on here.

content.cn_text: 另外，发给考虑明年来就读的学生的材料中也包括这次展览的信息。
content.en_text: And it's included in the information that's sent to people who are considering applying to study here next year.

content.cn_text: 凯西：会不会还有一些学生和讲师来？
content.en_text: CATHY: Presumably some current students and lecturers will come?

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：我猜是这样的，但是学校通知我们专注于其他的参观者。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: I would imagine so, but we've been told to concentrate on the other categories of people.

content.cn_text: 凯西：好的。展览不一定要涵盖19世纪文学的所有类别是吗？
content.en_text: CATHY: Right. We don't have to cover the whole range of 19th-century literature, do we?

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：不用，完全由我们自己决定。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: No, it's entirely up to us.

content.cn_text: 我觉得只涉及查尔斯·狄更斯即可。
content.en_text: I suggest just using Charles Dickens.

content.cn_text: 凯西：好主意。
content.en_text: CATHY: That's a good idea.

content.cn_text: 许多人听说过他，也许读过他的一些著作或者看过根据他的作品改编的电影。这可以方便我们导入他的生平事迹。
content.en_text: Most people have heard of him, and have probably read some of his novels, or seen films based on them, so that's a good lead-in to life in his time.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：正是这样。他的许多小说描绘了大部分人不得不接受的，十分艰难的时代，不是吗？他想要警醒读者，使之采取行动。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: Exactly. And his novels show the awful conditions that most people had to live in, don't they: he wanted to shock people into doing something about it.

content.cn_text: 凯西：除了写作之外，他还参与了什么活动吗？
content.en_text: CATHY: Did he do any campaigning, other than writing?

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：是的，他参与了有关教育和其它社会改革的活动，发表讲演。但是我更倾向于忽略这部分，只关注他的作品。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: Yes, he campaigned for education and other social reforms, and gave talks, but I'm inclined to ignore that and focus on the novels.

content.cn_text: 凯西：是的，我也这样觉得。
content.en_text: CATHY: Yes, I agree.

content.cn_text: 凯西：好的，那么我们要不要给每本小说想个有关联的主题？
content.en_text: CATHY: OK, so now shall we think about a topic linked to each novel?

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：是的，我已经将狄更斯的作品按照出版顺序打印了一份清单出来，希望你能同意我们只讲有关他的内容。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: Yes. I've printed out a list of Dickens's novels in the order they were published, in the hope you'd agree to focus on him!

content.cn_text: 凯西：太巧了，我之前也和你想的一样。让我们一起看看。
content.en_text: CATHY: You're lucky I did agree! Let's have a look.

content.cn_text: 好的，第一本叫做《匹克威克外传》，出版于1836年。
content.en_text: OK, the first was The Pickwick Papers, published in 1836.

content.cn_text: 作品一经出版就大受欢迎，不是吗？当时就被改编成为戏剧在剧院演出了。
content.en_text: It was very successful when it came out, wasn't it, and was adapted for the theatre straight away.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：但是，有个有趣的事情。那就是小说里有个嗜睡的角色，这种病症也是根据小说命名的，叫做匹克威克综合症。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: There's an interesting point, though, that there's a character who keeps falling asleep, and that medical condition was named after the book - Pickwickian Syndrome.

content.cn_text: 凯西：是吗，那我们为什么不用这个作为主题，再引用一些小说里的句子呢？
content.en_text: CATHY: Oh, so why don't we use that as the topic, and include some quotations from the novel?

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：没问题。下一本是《雾都孤儿》。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: Right. Next is Oliver Twist.

content.cn_text: 书里有很多关于贫困的描写。
content.en_text: There's a lot in the novel about poverty.

content.cn_text: 但是还有其它更隐晦的……
content.en_text: But maybe something less obvious …

content.cn_text: 凯西：奥利弗跟人学会了偷东西，对不对？
content.en_text: CATHY: Well Oliver is taught how to steal, isn't he?

content.cn_text: 我们可以用这一点来陈述事实，那就是儿童，尤其是穷人家的儿童几乎没人去学校接受教育，所以他们得通过其它方式学习。
content.en_text: We could use that to illustrate the fact that very few children went to school, particularly not poor children, so they learnt in other ways.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：好主意。下一本是什么？
content.en_text: GRAHAM: Good idea. What's next?

content.cn_text: 凯西：好像是《少爷返乡》。
content.en_text: CATHY: Maybe Nicholas Nickleby.

content.cn_text: 事实上，他的学校环境特别残酷，是不是？
content.en_text: Actually he taught in a really cruel school, didn't he?

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：对的。但尼古拉斯还加入了巡演演员的行列。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: That's right. But there's also the company of touring actors that Nicholas joins.

content.cn_text: 我们可以再展示一些当时的戏剧和其他的娱乐活动。
content.en_text: We could do something on theatres and other amusements of the time.

content.cn_text: 我们也不想只说阴暗面对吗？
content.en_text: We don't want only the bad things, do we?

content.cn_text: 凯西：是的。
content.en_text: CATHY: OK.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：用《马丁·瞿述伟》怎么样？
content.en_text: GRAHAM: What about Martin Chuzzlewit?

content.cn_text: 主人公去了美国，是吗？
content.en_text: He goes to the USA, doesn't he?

content.cn_text: 凯西：是的，狄更斯自己也去过一年，他的小说灵感就是他的亲身经历。
content.en_text: CATHY: Yes, and Dickens himself had been there a year before, and drew on his experience there in the novel.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：但我有点儿不明白……小说的主题是自私性，所以我们可以说一些有关社会公正的方面？
content.en_text: GRAHAM: I wonder, though … The main theme is selfishness, so we could do something on social justice?

content.cn_text: 不，这样太概括了，我们还是保留你的意见吧。我觉得那样应该不错。
content.en_text: No, too general, let's keep to your idea - I think it would work well.

content.cn_text: 凯西：接着他又写了《荒凉山庄》，他所有的小说里我最喜欢这部。
content.en_text: CATHY: He wrote Bleak House next - that's my favourite of his novels.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：是的，也是我最喜欢的。他对法律系统的嘲讽十分有力。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: Yes, mine too. His satire of the legal system is pretty powerful.

content.cn_text: 凯西：确实是，但是想想女主人公艾瑟。
content.en_text: CATHY: That's true, but think about Esther, the heroine.

content.cn_text: 小的时候她和她的阿姨一起住，但是她并不知道她们的亲戚关系。她的阿姨对她很不好。
content.en_text: As a child she lives with someone she doesn't know is her aunt, who treats her very badly.

content.cn_text: 接着，她很高兴地和她的监护人住在一起了，他还让她管家。
content.en_text: Then she's very happy living with her guardian, and he puts her in charge of the household.

content.cn_text: 最终她结婚了。她的监护人给了她和她丈夫一所房子。当然，他们在那里快乐地生活了。
content.en_text: And at the end she gets married and her guardian gives her and her husband a house, where of course they're very happy.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：是的，我喜欢这个结局。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: Yes, I like that.

content.cn_text: 凯西：接下来要讲什么？《小杜丽》？
content.en_text: CATHY: What shall we take next? Little Dorrit?

content.cn_text: 老杜丽先生因负债入狱多年。
content.en_text: Old Mr Dorrit has been in a debtors' prison for years …

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：狄更斯的父亲也是这样，对不对？
content.en_text: GRAHAM: So was Dickens's father, wasn't he?

content.cn_text: 凯西：是的。
content.en_text: CATHY: That's right.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：书中有一部分说到杜丽先生继承了一大笔财产，他开始假装他一直很有钱。我们关注这个情节怎么样？
content.en_text: GRAHAM: What about focusing on the part when Mr Dorrit inherits a fortune, and he starts pretending he's always been rich?

content.cn_text: 凯西：好主意。
content.en_text: CATHY: Good idea.

content.cn_text: 格雷汉姆：好了。接下来我们需要想想要陈述的每个主题需要什么材料。
content.en_text: GRAHAM: OK, so next we need to think about what materials we want to illustrate each issue.

content.cn_text: 这一步的难度会很大。
content.en_text: That's going to be quite hard.

questions.answer_content: He used his publications to draw attention to social problems.

questions.title: The Pickwick Papers
Oliver Twist
Nicholas Nickleby
Martin Chuzzlewit
Bleak House
Little Dorrit

content.cn_text: 我将要向大家介绍一个项目的实例分析。该项目的成立是为了帮助莫桑比克的农村人口。莫桑比克是非洲东南部的农业大国。
content.en_text: I'm going to report on a case study of a programme which has been set up to help rural populations in Mozambique, a largely agricultural country in South-East Africa.

content.cn_text: 该项目与林波波河附近的奇夸拉夸拉地区的三个团体合作。
content.en_text: The programme worked with three communities in Chicualacuala district, near the Limpopo River.

content.cn_text: 这个地区气候干燥，降水不规律。
content.en_text: This is a dry and arid region, with unpredictable rainfall.

content.cn_text: 正因如此，该地区居民单靠农业难以维持生计。所以当地居民依靠森林资源获得收入，主要通过售卖木炭。
content.en_text: Because of this, people in the area were unable to support themselves through agriculture and instead they used the forest as a means of providing themselves with an income, mainly by selling charcoal.

content.cn_text: 然而，这种方式却不能够长期维持，因为他们快速消耗了森林资源。
content.en_text: However, this was not a sustainable way of living in the long term, as they were rapidly using up this resource.

content.cn_text: 为了支持这一干燥地区的农业，该项目主要专注于使用林波波河的现有水资源来建立灌溉系统，为作物和动物提供可靠水源。
content.en_text: To support agriculture in this dry region, the programme focused primarily on making use of existing water resources from the Limpopo River by setting up systems of irrigation, which would provide a dependable water supply for crops and animals.

content.cn_text: 该项目还与地区政府紧密合作，目的是确定最好的执行办法。
content.en_text: The programme worked closely with the district government in order to find the best way of implementing this.

content.cn_text: 这一地区已经有一个农民协会，但是该项目决定再建立两个协会。
content.en_text: The region already had one farmers' association, and it was decided to set up two more of these.

content.cn_text: 这些协会安排开展许多活动，包括水力管理，牲畜养殖和农业活动等等。值得注意的是普遍来说女性成为主要劳动力。
content.en_text: These associations planned and carried out activities including water management, livestock breeding and agriculture, and it was notable that in general, women formed the majority of the workforce.

content.cn_text: 为了确保作物免受野生动物和家畜破坏，项目决定将作物生长区域作为特别区域，并用围栏隔开。
content.en_text: It was decided that in order to keep the crops safe from animals, both wild and domestic, special areas should be fenced off where the crops could be grown.

content.cn_text: 社区负责立好围栏，项目组则提供制作围栏必要的铁丝。
content.en_text: The community was responsible for creating these fences, but the programme provided the necessary wire for making them.

content.cn_text: 一旦隔出了专属区域，就可以发展农耕。
content.en_text: Once the area had been fenced off, it could be cultivated.

content.cn_text: 人们翻整土地，种植适合气候条件的蔬菜和谷类作物。该项目还提供了必需的种子。
content.en_text: The land was dug, so that vegetables and cereals appropriate to the climate could be grown, and the programme provided the necessary seeds for this.

content.cn_text: 除此之外，该项目还提供了水泵将河流的水通过管道泵向田地。
content.en_text: The programme also provided pumps so that water could be brought from the river in pipes to the fields.

content.cn_text: 但是，当地居民提供劳力，还拿来杆子，将它们立起来支撑田地附近的围栏。
content.en_text: However, the labour was all provided by local people, and they also provided and put up the posts that supported the fences around the fields.

content.cn_text: 项目一经建立，其发展受到全面的监管。
content.en_text: Once the programme had been set up, its development was monitored carefully.

content.cn_text: 农民们能够种植充足的作物满足自己生活和售卖的需求。
content.en_text: The farmers were able to grow enough produce not just for their own needs, but also to sell.

content.cn_text: 然而将农产品送到能够交易的市场又成了问题，因为农民们并没有合适的交通工具。这就导致了大量的农产品腐烂，尤其是蔬菜。
content.en_text: However, getting the produce to places where it could be marketed was sometimes a problem, as the farmers did not have access to transport, and this resulted in large amounts of produce, especially vegetables, being spoiled.

content.cn_text: 该项目与农民协会讨论之后决定，为了避免食物腐烂，农民们需要学习保鲜技术。
content.en_text: This problem was discussed with the farmers' associations and it was decided that in order to prevent food from being spoiled, the farmers needed to learn techniques for its preservation.

content.cn_text: 还有另外一个方案，这个方案最初并没有被提出，但是却成为了该项目的核心特色。
content.en_text: There was also an additional initiative that had not been originally planned, but which became a central feature of the programme.

content.cn_text: 方案提议农民可以在没有被围起的区域挖坑储水，用来养鱼。鱼是蛋白质的重要来源。
content.en_text: This was when farmers started to dig holes for tanks in the fenced-off areas and to fill these with water and use them for breeding fish - an important source of protein.

content.cn_text: 一段时间之后，该项目又采纳了当地居民提出的，一开始没有包括在最初提议中的另一条建议。
content.en_text: After a time, another suggestion was made by local people which hadn't been part of the programme's original proposal, but which was also adopted later on.

content.cn_text: 他们决定建巢养蜂。这可以为自用和销售提供蜂蜜。
content.en_text: They decided to try setting up colonies of bees, which would provide honey both for their own consumption and to sell.

content.cn_text: 那么我们可以从这个项目中学到什么呢？
content.en_text: So what lessons can be learned from this programme?

content.cn_text: 首先，这个经验告诉我们在干旱地区，只要有可靠的水源，就有发展农业的机会。
content.en_text: First of all, it tells us that in dry, arid regions, if there is access to a reliable source of water, there is great potential for the development of agriculture.

content.cn_text: 在奇夸拉夸拉，农业生产的发展可圈可点。它提高了食品安全，造福了当地居民，为他们提供了食物，创造了收入。
content.en_text: In Chicualacuala, there was a marked improvement in agricultural production, which improved food security and benefited local people by providing them with both food and income.

content.cn_text: 然而，为项目的每个阶段设立符合现实情况的时间线很重要，尤其是设计阶段，因为这一时期的错误可能很难在后期被纠正。
content.en_text: However, it's important to set realistic timelines for each phase of the programme, especially for its design, as mistakes made at this stage may be hard to correct later on.

content.cn_text: 这一项目展示了在某些地区可持续发展的可能性，像是……
content.en_text: The programme demonstrates that sustainable development is possible in areas where …

Further developments • The marketing of produce was sometimes difficult due to lack of 【36】 . • Training was therefore provided in methods of food 【37】 . • Farmers made special places where 【38】 could be kept. • Local people later suggested keeping 【39】 . Evaluation and lessons learned • Agricultural production increased, improving incomes and food security. • Enough time must be allowed, particularly for the 【40】 phase ofthe programme.

content.cn_text: 萨利：早上好。乔，十分感谢你来公司见我。
content.en_text: SALLY: Good morning. Thanks for coming in to see us here at the agency, Joe.

content.cn_text: 我是机构的代表之一，我叫萨利·贝克。
content.en_text: I'm one of the agency representatives, and my name's Sally Baker.

content.cn_text: 乔：你好，萨利。我想我们之前通过电话，对吗？
content.en_text: JOE: Hi Sally. I think we spoke on the phone, didn't we?

content.cn_text: 萨利：没错。
content.en_text: SALLY: That's right, we did.

content.cn_text: 感谢你发来你的简历。
content.en_text: So thank you for sending in your CV.

content.cn_text: 我们已经认真地看过了。我觉得目前可能有两份适合你的工作。
content.en_text: We've had quite a careful look at it and I think we have two jobs that might be suitable for you.

content.cn_text: 乔：好的。
content.en_text: JOE: OK.

content.cn_text: 萨利。第一份来自伦敦北部的一家公司。
content.en_text: SALLY: The first one is in a company based in North London.

content.cn_text: 招聘的是行政助理。
content.en_text: They're looking for an administrative assistant.

content.cn_text: 乔：好的。经营什么的公司？
content.en_text: JOE: OK. What sort of company is it?

content.cn_text: 萨利：是一家设计制作家具的公司，叫做家装解决者。
content.en_text: SALLY: They're called Home Solutions and they design and make furniture.

content.cn_text: 乔：是吗？我对它并不了解，但听起来不错。
content.en_text: JOE: Oh, I don't know much about that, but it sounds interesting.

content.cn_text: 萨利：是的，正如我刚才说到的，他们想要招聘一些办公室员工。你之前的经验看起来确实挺符合他们的要求的。
content.en_text: SALLY: Yes, well as I said, they want someone in their office, and looking at your past experience it does look as if you fit quite a few of the requirements.

content.cn_text: 从简历上看，你之前做过数据录入工作，是吗？
content.en_text: So on your CV it appears you've done some data entry?

content.cn_text: 乔：是的。
content.en_text: JOE: Yes.

content.cn_text: 萨利：这也正是他们希望员工掌握的技巧。
content.en_text: SALLY: So that's one skill they want.

content.cn_text: 另外，他们希望他们招聘的员工能够出席会议并做好会议笔记。
content.en_text: Then they expect the person they appoint to attend meetings and take notes there …

content.cn_text: 乔：好的。我之前也做过这些。
content.en_text: JOE: OK. I've done that before, yes.

content.cn_text: 萨利：而且你要能适应总务部的工作。
content.en_text: SALLY: And you'd need to be able to cope with general admin.

content.cn_text: 乔：归档，然后做记录这些？应该没问题。
content.en_text: JOE: Filing, and keeping records and so on? That should be OK.

content.cn_text: 上一份工作还需要我整理工作日志。
content.en_text: And in my last job I also had to manage the diary.

content.cn_text: 萨利：太好了。这也是他们要求的工作技能。
content.en_text: SALLY: Excellent. That's something they want here too.

content.cn_text: 我建议你把这些经验加到你的简历中，我记得你之前好像没提到，是吗？
content.en_text: I'd suggest you add it to your CV - I don't think you mentioned that, did you?

content.cn_text: 乔：没有。
content.en_text: JOE: No.

content.cn_text: 萨利：说到要求，熟练的电脑技能当然也是必须的。他们还特别提到了电子制表软件。
content.en_text: SALLY: So as far as the requirements go, they want good computer skills, of course, and they particularly mention spreadsheets.

content.cn_text: 乔：这些应该也没问题。
content.en_text: JOE: That should be fine.

content.cn_text: 萨利：还要有人际交往能力，他们可能会在你的推荐信中确认这个。
content.en_text: SALLY: And interpersonal skills - which would be something they'd check with your references.

content.cn_text: 乔：我觉得没问题。
content.en_text: JOE: I think that should be OK, yes.

content.cn_text: 萨利：还有他们提到了希望应聘者细心认真，注意细节。看你的简历，我觉得你可能也很符合。
content.en_text: SALLY: Then they mention that they want someone who is careful and takes care with details - just looking at your CV, I'd say you're probably alright there.

content.cn_text: 乔：我觉得也是。需要特别的工作经验吗？
content.en_text: JOE: I think so, yes. Do they want any special experience?

content.cn_text: 萨利：我觉得他们希望应聘者有过电话会议工作的经验。
content.en_text: SALLY: I think they wanted some experience of teleconferencing.

content.cn_text: 乔：我之前有过三年的经验。
content.en_text: JOE: I've got three years' experience of that.

content.cn_text: 萨利：我看看，哦，是的。
content.en_text: SALLY: Let's see, yes, good.

content.cn_text: 事实上，他们要求的是至少有一年的工作经验，太棒了。
content.en_text: In fact they're only asking for at least one year, so that's great.

content.cn_text: 所以这份工作你感兴趣吗？
content.en_text: So is that something that might interest you?

content.cn_text: 乔：是的。唯一的就是你刚才提到他们是在伦敦北部，所以对我来说通勤时间会很长。
content.en_text: JOE: It is, yes. The only thing is, you said they were in North London so it would be quite a long commute for me.

content.cn_text: 萨利：理解了。
content.en_text: SALLY: OK.

content.cn_text: 萨利：要是说地点的话，第二份工作也许更适合你。伦敦南部的一家公司在招聘仓库助理。
content.en_text: SALLY: So the second position might suit you better as far as the location goes; that's for a warehouse assistant and that's in South London.

content.cn_text: 乔：这样距离就近多了。
content.en_text: JOE: Yes, that would be a lot closer.

content.cn_text: 萨利：你之前在仓库工作过，对吗？
content.en_text: SALLY: And you've worked in a warehouse before, haven't you?

content.cn_text: 乔：是的。
content.en_text: JOE: Yes.

content.cn_text: 萨利：说到这份工作的职责，很明显，他们希望应聘者能够管理库存和交货。
content.en_text: SALLY: So as far as the responsibilities for this position go, they want someone who can manage the stock, obviously, and also deliveries.

content.cn_text: 乔：这应该没问题。
content.en_text: JOE: That should be OK.

content.cn_text: 这份工作需要员工记录数字，而我对数字一向很在行。
content.en_text: You've got to keep track of stuff, but I've always been quite good with numbers.

content.cn_text: 萨利：太好了。这是第一个要求。
content.en_text: SALLY: Good. That's their first requirement.

content.cn_text: 他们还希望应聘者精通电脑，我知道这对你来说也没有问题。
content.en_text: And they want someone who's computer literate, which we know you are.

content.cn_text: 乔：确实。
content.en_text: JOE: Sure.

content.cn_text: 萨利：然后他们还说到了组织技能。
content.en_text: SALLY: Then they mention organisational skills.

content.cn_text: 他们希望应聘者做事情要有条理。
content.en_text: They want someone who's well organised.

content.cn_text: 乔：好的，我觉得我还行。
content.en_text: JOE: Yes, I think I am.

content.cn_text: 萨利：还要利落。
content.en_text: SALLY: And tidy?

content.cn_text: 乔：是的，这两者是一致的，对不对？
content.en_text: JOE: Yes, they go together really, don't they?

content.cn_text: 萨利：确实。剩下的就是平常的要求了。他们希望应聘者有良好的口头和书面表达能力。
content.en_text: SALLY: Sure. Then the usual stuff; they want someone who can communicate well both orally and in writing.

content.cn_text: 乔：知道了。我之前在仓库工作的时候，最享受的一件事儿就是成为团队的一员。
content.en_text: JOE: OK. And for the last warehouse job I had, one of the things I enjoyed most was being part of a team.

content.cn_text: 我发现这对做好工作是十分重要的。
content.en_text: I found that was really essential for the job.

content.cn_text: 萨利：你说得太对了。是的，他们确实提到了希望应聘者能够习惯团队合作。
content.en_text: SALLY: Excellent. Yes, they do mention that they want someone who's used to that, yes.

content.cn_text: 好了。你上次在仓库工作是什么时候？你主要处理什么物品？
content.en_text: Now when you were working in a warehouse last time, what sorts of items were you dealing with?

content.cn_text: 乔：主要是浴室和厨房设备，水槽、炉灶和冰箱。
content.en_text: JOE: It was mostly bathroom and kitchen equipment, sinks and stoves and fridges.

content.cn_text: 萨利：你能够搬重物吗？
content.en_text: SALLY: So you're OK moving heavy things?

content.cn_text: 乔：当然。我身体很强壮，我之前接受过培训。
content.en_text: JOE: Sure. I'm quite strong, and I've had the training.

content.cn_text: 萨利：好的。说到经验，招聘单位希望应聘者有驾照，还要有在伦敦驾驶的经验。这样你可以应付交通情况等等。
content.en_text: SALLY: Good. Now as far as experience goes, they mention they want someone with a licence, and that you have experience of driving in London - so you can cope with the traffic and so on.

content.cn_text: 乔：好的，没问题。
content.en_text: JOE: Yes, no problem.

content.cn_text: 萨利：你有过在仓库工作的经验……最后一项就是客户服务。
content.en_text: SALLY: And you've got experience of warehouse work … and the final thing they mention is customer service.

content.cn_text: 我记得从你的简历上看你这方面还不错，
content.en_text: I think looking at your CV you're OK there.

content.cn_text: 乔：是的。薪酬怎么样呢？
content.en_text: JOE: Right. So what about pay?

content.cn_text: 麻烦你告诉我一些关于报酬的信息……
content.en_text: Can you tell me a bit more about that, please …

content.cn_text: 主持人：今天我邀请来的嘉宾是爱丽丝·里凯斯。她住在比奇伍德路，在这里她发起了街头玩耍计划。
content.en_text: PRESENTER: My guest on the show today is Alice Riches who started the Street Play Scheme where she lives in Beechwood Road.

content.cn_text: 为还不了解的观众解释一下，街头玩耍计划是指为了让孩子们有机会安全地在街上玩耍，当地居民封闭街道数小时。
content.en_text: For those of you that don't already know - Street Play involves local residents closing off their street for a few hours so that children have a chance to play in the street safely.

content.cn_text: 她在自己居住的街道——比奇伍德路首先发起倡议。这种做法变得流行，现在全市都有街头玩耍项目了。
content.en_text: She started it in her own street, Beechwood Road, and the idea caught on, and there are now Street Play Schemes all over the city.

content.cn_text: 那么爱丽丝，你实际上是从什么时候开始了这个项目的呢？
content.en_text: So when did you actually start the scheme, Alice?

content.cn_text: 爱丽丝：在我的长子还在学走路的时候，大约是6年前，我第一次有了这个念头。但是在我们实际能够实现计划之前我花了至少两年的时间进行宣传活动。
content.en_text: ALICE: Well, I first had the idea when my oldest child was still a toddler, so that's about six years ago now - but it took at least two years of campaigning before we were actually able to make it happen.

content.cn_text: 所以到现在这个计划已经实行了三年了。
content.en_text: So the scheme's been up and running for three years now.

content.cn_text: 我们希望能够将道路封闭更长时间——整个周末。比如从周六早上封闭到周日晚上。
content.en_text: We'd love to be able to close our road for longer - for the whole weekend, from Saturday morning until Sunday evening, for example.

content.cn_text: 现在只是一周封闭一次。
content.en_text: At the moment it's just once a week.

content.cn_text: 但是在项目一开始的时候一个月才封闭一次。
content.en_text: But when we started it was only once a month.

content.cn_text: 我们还会不断努力。
content.en_text: But we're working on it.

content.cn_text: 主持人：所以当比奇伍德路封闭的时候会发生什么？
content.en_text: PRESENTER: So what actually happens when Beechwood Road is closed?

content.cn_text: 爱丽丝：我们有志愿看守人，大部分都是孩子父母，但是也有年长的居民。他们在每个路口封锁车辆。
content.en_text: ALICE: We have volunteer wardens, mostly parents but some elderly residents too, who block off our road at either end.

content.cn_text: 议会提供了特别的指示标志，但是一直有志愿者向驾驶人解释发生了什么。
content.en_text: The council have provided special signs but there's always a volunteer there to explain what's happening to any motorists.

content.cn_text: 司机们通常都没有问题。只有一两次需要找警察帮忙。
content.en_text: Generally, they're fine about it - we've only had to get the police involved once or twice.

content.cn_text: 现在我应该解释一下道路并不是完全封闭不能通车。
content.en_text: Now I should explain that the road isn't completely closed to cars.

content.cn_text: 只有当地居民的车可以通过。
content.en_text: But only residents' cars are allowed.

content.cn_text: 如果人们真的需要在比奇伍德路进出的话，也不是问题。只要司机的车速在每小时20公里以下即可。
content.en_text: If people really need to get in or out of Beechwood Road, it's not a problem - as long as they drive at under 20 kilometres per hour.

content.cn_text: 但是大部分人决定这段时间不用车或者他们会把车停在另外一条街。
content.en_text: But most people just decide not to use their cars during this time, or they park in another street.

content.cn_text: 看守人只是在那里阻止车辆通行。
content.en_text: The wardens are only there to stop through traffic.

content.cn_text: 主持人：那么任何人都能申请参加街道玩耍项目吗？
content.en_text: PRESENTER: So can anyone apply to get involved in Street Play?

content.cn_text: 爱丽丝：当然了。我们希望全市的孩子都参与进来，尤其是那些住在繁忙街道的孩子。他们出来玩儿的渴望是最强烈的。
content.en_text: ALICE: Absolutely - we want to include all kids in the city - especially those who live on busy roads. It's here that demand is greatest.

content.cn_text: 很明显，在相对富裕的地方，孩子们可以去公园或者大花园玩儿——或者在郊区，有很多可供孩子在户外玩耍的地方，所以这些区域想参与的人不多。
content.en_text: Obviously, there isn't such demand in wealthier areas where the children have access to parks or large gardens - or in the suburbs where there are usually more places for children to play outside.

content.cn_text: 我建议听众们如果喜欢这个主意的话都可以试一试。
content.en_text: I'd recommend that anyone listening who likes the idea should just give it a go.

content.cn_text: 全城范围内居民的积极反应特别让人惊喜。
content.en_text: We've been surprised by the positive reaction of residents all over the city.

content.cn_text: 而且，反馈不光来自父母。
content.en_text: And that's not just parents.

content.cn_text: 还是会有一些抱怨的人，但是他们只是少数。
content.en_text: There are always a few who complain but they're a tiny minority.

content.cn_text: 整体来说，虽然有的时候会很吵，但所有人都很支持，他们很高兴看到孩子能在街道上玩儿。
content.en_text: On the whole everyone is very supportive and say they're very happy to see children out on the street - even if it does get quite noisy.

content.cn_text: 爱丽丝：街道玩耍项目对孩子很有好处。
content.en_text: ALICE: There have been so many benefits of Street Play for the kids.

content.cn_text: 虽然孩子们没有做什么特别消耗体力的事儿，父母们还是很喜欢孩子们出去呼吸新鲜的空气而不是坐在电脑屏幕前。
content.en_text: Parents really like the fact that the kids are getting fresh air instead of sitting staring at a computer screen, even if they're not doing anything particularly energetic.

content.cn_text: 当然了，孩子们在不被家长看管的情况下和伙伴们一起玩儿实在太好了。但是在我看来，最大的好处是孩子们能够培养自信，敢于在没有父母陪伴的时候到户外去。
content.en_text: And of course it's great that kids can play with their friends outside without being supervised by their parents - but for me the biggest advantage is that kids develop confidence in themselves to be outside without their parents.

content.cn_text: 另一个美妙之处在于孩子们可以熟悉在这条街道生活的大人们，就像是有了更大的家庭一样。
content.en_text: The other really fantastic thing is that children get to know the adults in the street - it's like having a big extended family.

content.cn_text: 主持人：这个项目确实有很多好处。
content.en_text: PRESENTER: It certainly does have a lot of benefits.

content.cn_text: 我想要再问你一下国王街的相关项目。
content.en_text: I want to move on now and ask you about a related project in King Street.

content.cn_text: 爱丽丝：好的。这是我参与的一个实验。国王街是我们区最繁忙的一条主街。当地居民决定劝说人们，选择一天不开车来减少街上的车流量。
content.en_text: ALICE: Right. Well this was an experiment I was involved in where local residents decided to try and reduce the traffic along King Street, which is the busiest main road in our area, by persuading people not to use their cars for one day.

content.cn_text: 我们想过增加停车费，但是我们最终确定这种方式不会有人支持。所以，取而代之，我们只是不许司机在国王街停车，但是保留了其他的停车场。
content.en_text: We thought about making people pay more for parking - but we decided that would be really unpopular - so instead we just stopped people from parking on King Street but left the other car parks open.

content.cn_text: 这个决定的影响是惊人的。
content.en_text: It was surprising how much of a difference all this made.

content.cn_text: 正如我们所料，空气质量明显提升。但是我们没有预料到的是尽管公交车仍然在运行，街上变得特别安静。
content.en_text: As we'd predicted, air quality was significantly better but what I hadn't expected was how much quieter it would be - even with the buses still running.

content.cn_text: 当然了，人们都说自己感觉更安全了。事实上，我们惊讶地发现当天街上商店的营业额大幅提升。我们本以为购物的人数会只减不增。
content.en_text: Of course everyone said they felt safer but we were actually amazed that sales in the shops went up considerably that day - we thought there'd be fewer people out shopping - not more.

content.cn_text: 主持人：那确实很有趣，所以……
content.en_text: PRESENTER: That's really interesting so the fact that …

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：汤姆，请问我能向你征求一些意见吗？
content.en_text: HAZEL: Tom, could I ask you for some advice, please?

content.cn_text: 汤姆：当然可以了，只要你觉得我能帮得上忙。关于什么的？
content.en_text: TOM: Yes of course, if you think I can help. What's it about?

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：是我的第一份关于媒体研究的作业，我不确定要怎么做。
content.en_text: HAZEL: It's my first media studies assignment, and I'm not sure how to go about it.

content.cn_text: 你去年一定做过这个。
content.en_text: You must have done it last year.

content.cn_text: 汤姆：是比较不同报刊中的对特定故事报道的那个吗？
content.en_text: TOM: Is that the one comparing the coverage of a particular story in a range of newspapers?

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：就是那个。
content.en_text: HAZEL: That's right.

content.cn_text: 汤姆：对，我写过。我当时还写得很开心。
content.en_text: TOM: Oh yes, I really enjoyed writing it.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：所以我需要比较哪些事情呢？
content.en_text: HAZEL: So what sort of things do I need to compare?

content.cn_text: 汤姆：有很多可比的。
content.en_text: TOM: Well, there are several things.

content.cn_text: 比如，关于报道出现在报纸的哪一版面。
content.en_text: For example, there's the question of which page of the newspaper the item appears on.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：你的意思是，比方说，把它放在报纸头版和在第十页的底部是有很大差别的？
content.en_text: HAZEL: You mean, because there's a big difference between having it on the front page and the bottom of page ten, for instance?

content.cn_text: 汤姆：你说对了。 这还显示出编辑对报道的重视程度。
content.en_text: TOM: Exactly. And that shows how important the editor thinks the story is.

content.cn_text: 然后还可以讨论篇幅。报道的列长是多少，占了几列。
content.en_text: Then there's the size - how many column inches the story is given, how many columns it spreads over.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：我觉得还应该包括标题。
content.en_text: HAZEL: And I suppose that includes the headline.

content.cn_text: 汤姆：当然了。就是这部分吸引读者的注意力。
content.en_text: TOM: It certainly does. It's all part of attracting the reader's attention.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：配图呢？文本旁边有没有加上任何可视化信息？
content.en_text: HAZEL: What about graphics - whether there's anything visual in addition to the text?

content.cn_text: 汤姆：可以。你也需要考虑那些，因为它们会很大程度上影响读者对报道的理解，有的时候比文章本身的影响还要大。
content.en_text: TOM: Yes, you need to consider those, too, because they can have a big effect on the reader's understanding of the story - sometimes a bigger effect than the text itself.

content.cn_text: 接着，你需要看看整个故事是怎么编排的：报道的结构是什么？
content.en_text: Then you'll need to look at how the item is put together: what structure is it given?

content.cn_text: 你要记住很多人都只读第一段，所以记者在文章开头写了什么？
content.en_text: Bear in mind that not many people read beyond the first paragraph, so what has the journalist put at the beginning?

content.cn_text: 还有，比如，假设有冲突的观点，如果它出现在报道结尾的话，大家是不是可能不会读到？
content.en_text: And if, say, there are conflicting opinions about something, does one appear near the end, where people probably won't read it?

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：另外，新闻有时候会呈现错误或者有误导性的消息，对吗？
content.en_text: HAZEL: And newspapers sometimes give wrong or misleading information, don't they?

content.cn_text: 不管是故意的还是不小心的。
content.en_text: Either deliberately or by accident.

content.cn_text: 我要不要也说一下这个？
content.en_text: Should I be looking at that, too?

content.cn_text: 汤姆：如果你能完成，可以。比较不同的版本，尽可能地区分开真实的和错误的信息。
content.en_text: TOM: Yes, if you can. Compare what's in different versions, and as far as possible, try and work out what's true and what isn't.

content.cn_text: 那么这就牵扯出一个非常重要的问题：作者的写作目的是什么。如果有好几个，至少找到最重要的那一个。
content.en_text: And that relates to a very important point: what's the writer's purpose, or at least the most important one, if they have several.

content.cn_text: 看起来可能是为了向公众传递信息，但是他们经常想要制造恐慌或争议，或是想要让某些人出丑。
content.en_text: It may seem to be to inform the public, but often it's that they want to create fear, or controversy, or to make somebody look ridiculous.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：天哪，我懂你的意思。
content.en_text: HAZEL: Gosh, I see what you mean.

content.cn_text: 我认为作者可能做出关于读者的假设。
content.en_text: And I suppose the writer may make assumptions about the reader.

content.cn_text: 汤姆：是的，关于他们对这一题材的了解、态度和教育水平。这就意味着作者需要写出让读者理解的文章，而不是居高临下。
content.en_text: TOM: That's right - about their knowledge of the subject, their attitudes, and their level of education, which means writing so that the readers understand without feeling patronised.

content.cn_text: 所有这些都会影响报道的呈现。
content.en_text: All of that will make a difference to how the story is presented.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：我写什么类型的故事重要吗？
content.en_text: HAZEL: Does it matter what type of story I write about?

content.cn_text: 汤姆：不重要，国内国际政治，艺术……
content.en_text: TOM: No - national or international politics, the arts ...

content.cn_text: 什么都行，只要在两三份报纸上报道过就行。
content.en_text: Anything, as long as it's covered in two or three newspapers.

content.cn_text: 当然了，如果写你自己感兴趣或者特别了解的某些话题做起来会更容易也更有趣。
content.en_text: Though of course it'll be easier and more fun if it's something you're interested in and know something about.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：这么说的话，一个国内的新闻报道应该值得分析。我很关心政治，所以我会尝试找到合适的话题。
content.en_text: HAZEL: And on that basis a national news item would be worth analysing - I'm quite keen on politics, so I'll try and find a suitable topic.

content.cn_text: 汤姆，你是怎么选择你的分析内容的？
content.en_text: What did you choose for your analysis, Tom?

content.cn_text: 汤姆：我对报纸如何明确表达观点很感兴趣，所以当时我想比较不同报纸的社论。但是，在我开始研究的时候，我找不到两篇我想分析的、讲述相同话题的报道。
content.en_text: TOM: I was interested in how newspapers express their opinions explicitly, so I wanted to compare editorials in different papers, but when I started looking, I couldn't find two on the same topic that I felt like analysing.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：那种情况下，我就不会去看了。
content.en_text: HAZEL: In that case, I won't even bother to look.

content.cn_text: 汤姆：所以最后我选择了人们都感兴趣的话题，是一个特别引发人们情感的故事：一个小女孩生病了，很多人，大多数是陌生人给她捐款筹钱，所以她能够去国外接受治疗。
content.en_text: TOM: So in the end I chose a human interest story - a terribly emotional story about a young girl who was very ill, and lots of other people - mostly strangers - raised money so she could go abroad for treatment.

content.cn_text: 实际上，我特别吃惊。因为一些报纸只说了大家是有多善良，但是其它的报纸从更高的角度考虑，比如讨论为什么在我们国家无法治疗。
content.en_text: Actually, I was surprised - some papers just wrote about how wonderful everyone was, but others considered the broader picture, like why treatment wasn't available here.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：嗯，我经常发现这样的故事会让我很激动。我会避开这一类。
content.en_text: HAZEL: Hmm, I usually find stories like that raise quite strong feelings in me! I'll avoid that.

content.cn_text: 也许我会选择艺术，比如一部电影的不同评论。或者关于艺术基金的。我会好好考虑。
content.en_text: Perhaps I'll choose an arts topic, like different reviews of a film, or something about funding for the arts - I'll think about that.

content.cn_text: 汤姆：好的，应该会很有趣的。
content.en_text: TOM: Yes, that might be interesting.

content.cn_text: 黑兹尔：好的，谢谢你的帮助，汤姆。
content.en_text: HAZEL: OK, well thanks a lot for your help, Tom.

content.cn_text: 你的建议真的很有用。
content.en_text: It's been really useful.

content.cn_text: 汤姆：客气啦。希望你的作业完成得顺利，黑兹尔。
content.en_text: TOM: You're welcome. Good luck with the assignment, Hazel.
